### <a href="https://vjudge.net/contest/354182#problem/C" target="_blank">Day 16: DivRem Number</a>

There is some problem in the rendering of the problem. It should say:

$$\lfloor \frac{N}{m} \rfloor = N \bmod m$$

**Solution:**

We known from the division theorem that:

$$N = \lfloor \frac{N}{m} \rfloor \cdot m + N \bmod m$$

Let $k = \lfloor \frac{N}{m} \rfloor = N \bmod m$

Then, we have:

$$N = k \cdot m + k$$
$$N = k \cdot (m + 1)$$

Then, m + 1 must be a divisor of $N$, so we can generate all the divisors of
$N$ and check if the condition holds in $O(\sqrt{N}).


  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblemproblem-16" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblemproblem-16" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  ll n;
  cin >> n;
  vector <ll> div;
  for (ll d = 1; d * d <= n; d++) {
    if (n % d == 0) {
      if (d != 1) div.push_back(d);
      if (d != n / d) div.push_back(n / d);
    }
  }
  ll ans = 0;
  for (ll d: div) {
    ll m = d - 1;
    if (n % m == n / m) {
      ans += m;
    }
  }
  cout << ans << endl;
  return (0);
}
```

  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->

</div>
</div>
</div>

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/problemset/problem/1293/A" target="_blank">Day 15: ConneR and the A.R.C. Markland-N</a>

There are $k$ closed restaurants, thefore we will find the answer in $O(k)$
steps, so a brute force solution in enough.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblemproblem-15" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblemproblem-15" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;
typedef vector <int> vi;
typedef vector <ll> vll;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int tc;
  cin >> tc;
  while (tc--) {
    int n, s, k;
    cin >> n >> s >> k;
    set <int> st;
    for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
      int a;
      cin >> a;
      st.insert(a);
    }
    int ans = INT_MAX;
    for (int d = 0; ; d++) {
      for (int sign: {1, -1}) {
        int cur = s + sign * d;
        if (1 <= cur and cur <= n and st.count(cur) == 0) {
          ans = d;
        }
      }
      if (ans != INT_MAX) break;
    }
    cout << ans << '\n';
  }
  return (0);
}
```

### <a href="https://abc125.contest.atcoder.jp/tasks/abc125_b?lang=en" target="_blank">Day 14: Resale</a>

Each element can be added to $X$ or to $Y$.

Let $b = b_nb_{n - 1} \dots b_1$ be a bit mask where $b_i = 1$ if the $i-th$
element is taken and $b_i = 0$ if the $i-th$ is not taken, then
we realize that all possible masks are $b \in [0, 2 ^n)$. In this way, we can
implement an $O(n 2^n)$ solution and that is enough.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblemproblem-14" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblemproblem-14" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  vector <int> v(n), c(n);
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) cin >> v[i];
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) cin >> c[i];
  int ans = 0;
  for (int mask = 0; mask < (1 << n); mask++) {
    int x = 0, y = 0;
    for (int bit = 0; bit < n; bit++) if ((mask >> bit) & 1) x += v[bit], y += c[bit];
    ans = max(ans, x - y);
  }
  cout << ans << endl;
  return (0);
}
```

  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->

We can also implement the above idea using backtracking.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblemproblem-14-b" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblemproblem-14-b" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
     
#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair
     
using namespace std;
     
typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;
typedef vector <int> vi;
typedef vector <ll> vll;

int n;
vi v, c;

int backtrack (int pos, int x, int y) {
  if (pos == n) return x - y;
  return max(backtrack(pos + 1, x + v[pos], y + c[pos]), backtrack(pos + 1, x, y));
}

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  cin >> n;
  v.resize(n);
  c.resize(n);
  for (int& elem: v) cin >> elem;
  for (int& elem: c) cin >> elem;
  cout << backtrack(0, 0, 0) << '\n';
  return (0);
}
```

  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->

There is another solution. If we take the elements $i_1, i_2, i_k$ then we have:

$$(v_{i_1} + v_{i_2} + \dots v_{i_k}) - (c_{i_1} + c_{i_2} + \dots + c_{i_k})$$

We can write the above expression in this way:

$$(v_{i_1} - c_{i_1}) + (v_{i_2} - c_{i_2}) + \dots + (v_{i_k} - c_{i_k})$$

Therefore, if $v_{i} - c_{i}$ is positive, we take the $i-th$ element, else we
do not.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblemproblem-14-c" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblemproblem-14-c" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
     
#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair
     
using namespace std;
     
typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;
typedef vector <int> vi;
typedef vector <ll> vll;

int n;
vi v, c;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  cin >> n;
  v.resize(n);
  c.resize(n);
  for (int& elem: v) cin >> elem;
  for (int& elem: c) cin >> elem;
  int ans = 0;
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    if (v[i] - c[i] > 0) ans += v[i] - c[i];
  }
  cout << ans << '\n';
  return (0);
}
```

  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->


</div>

### <a href="https://atcoder.jp/contests/abc134/tasks/abc134_c" target="_blank">Day 13: Exception Handling</a>

**First solution:** Notice that the answer will allways be the greatest value or the second greatest value. We can find these values in $O(n)$ or in $O(n \log n)$.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem13" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem13" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
     
#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair
     
using namespace std;
     
typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;
typedef vector <int> vi;
typedef vector <ll> vll;
     
int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  vi A(n);
  for (int& elem: A) cin >> elem;
  vi B = A;
  sort(rall(B));
  for (int elem: A) {
    if (elem != B[0]) cout << B[0] << '\n';
    else cout << B[1] << '\n';
  }
  return (0);
}
```

  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->

**Second solution:** We need to compute:

$$\max(A_1, A_2, \dots, A_{i - 1}), \max(A_{i}, A_{i + 1}, \dots, A_{n})$$

Let:

$$left[0] = 0$$
$$left[i] = \max(left[i - 1], A[i])$$

$$right[n + 1] = 0$$
$$right[n] = \max(right[n + 1], A[i])$$

Then, we need to compute: $\max(left[i - 1], right[i + 1])$, but we can compute $left, right$ in $O(n)$ using the idea of prefix sums. Therefore, we can solve the problem in $O(n)$.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem13-b" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem13-b" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  vector <int> arr(n + 1);
  for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) cin >> arr[i];
  vector <int> left(n + 1);
  left[0] = 0;
  for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) left[i] = max(left[i - 1], arr[i]);
  vector <int> right(n + 2);
  right[n + 1] = 0;
  for (int i = n; i >= 0; i--) right[i] = max(right[i + 1], arr[i]);
  for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) cout << max(left[i - 1], right[i + 1]) << '\n';
  return (0);
}
```

  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->


</div>
</div>

### <a href="https://abc137.contest.atcoder.jp/tasks/abc137_c?lang=en" target="_blank">Day 12: Green Bin</a>

If $s \land t$ are anagrams, then $sort(all(a)) = sort(all(b))$. That is, if we
sort the letters of a string, we have a representative of a set of anagrams.
Moreover, if we have $x$ string of the same anagram class, we can choose
$\binom{x}{2}$ indices such that $s_i \land s_j$ are anagrams. In this way, we
can implement a solution in $O(N \log N)$.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem12" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem12" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  map <string, int> mp;
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    string s;
    cin >> s;
    sort(all(s));
    mp[s]++;
  }
  ll ans = 0;
  for (auto pp: mp) {
    ll cnt = pp.second;
    ans += cnt * (cnt - 1) / 2;
  }
  cout << ans << '\n';
  return (0);
}
```

  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->

</div>
</div>
</div>

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/contest/1271/problem/B" target="_blank">Day 11: Blocks</a>

Each block should end up being black or white. You can fix what color the
string will be and try to change it in a loop (if you are in iteration `i` you
have already change $s[0: i - 1]$, now if $s[i] \not = \text{the color you have fixed}$,
invert $s[i], s[i + 1]$). In this way you need at most $n - 1$ operations.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem11" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem11" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;

void solve (string s, char ch) {
  vector <int> ans;
  for (int i = 0; i + 1 < sz(s); i++) {
    if (s[i] != ch) {
      s[i] = ch;
      s[i + 1] = (s[i + 1] == 'B') ? 'W' : 'B';
      ans.pb(i + 1);
    }
  }
  if (s.back() != ch) return;
  cout << sz(ans) << '\n';
  for (int elem: ans) cout << elem << ' ';
  exit(0);
}

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  string s;
  cin >> s;
  solve(s, 'W');
  solve(s, 'B');
  cout << -1 << '\n';
  return (0);
}
```

  </div>

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/problemset/problem/1293/B" target="_blank">Day 10: JOE is on TV!</a>

You can notice that the optimal strategy is that in each turn one opponent fail
to answer. Then, our answer is

$$\frac{1}{n} + \frac{1}{n - 1} + \frac{1}{n - 2} + \dots + \frac{1}{1}$$

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem10" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem10" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;
typedef vector <int> vi;
typedef vector <ll> vll;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  long double sum = 0;
  for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
    long double x = i;
    sum += 1.0 / x;
  }
  cout << fixed << setprecision(12) << sum << '\n';
  return (0);
}
```

<!-- begin body -->

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/contest/181/problem/B" target="_blank">Day 09: Number of Triplets</a>

If you fix $A, C$ with two `fors`, you can get what value of $B$ you need.
Moreover, as all the points are integers, we can check if $A_x + C_x \land A_y + C_y$ are even in order to avoid working with floats. Now, we have fixed $B = ((A_x + C_x) / 2, (A_y + C_y) / 2)$ and we need to check if this point is in the input. We can do it with a set (you'll get TLE with a map) and solve the problem in $O(n^2 \log n)$.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem09" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem09" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

using namespace std;

int main () {
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  vector <pair <int, int>> point(n);
  set <pair <int, int>> st;
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    cin >> point[i].first >> point[i].second;
    st.insert(point[i]);
  }
  int ans = 0;
  for (int a = 0; a < n; a++) {
    for (int c = a + 1; c < n; c++) {
      pair <int, int> b;
      int x = point[a].first + point[c].first;
      int y = point[a].second + point[c].second;
      if (x % 2 or y % 2) continue;
      b.first = x / 2;
      b.second = y / 2;
      if (st.count(b)) ans++;
    }
  }
  cout << ans << endl;
  return (0);
}
```

  </div>
  <!-- ends code -->

Furthermore, you can check if a point is in the input in $O(1)$ storing the points in a matrix of booleans. But, as the coordinates can take negative values in $[-1000, 1000]$ you can associate to each number $(x, y) \to (x + 1000, y + 1000)$ (this is a biyection). Using it, each coordinate is non-negative, so we can store it in our matrix.

</div>
</div>
</div>
<!-- ends problem 09 -->

### <a href="https://www.spoj.com/problems/QUILT/en/" target="_blank">Day 08: Little Quilt</a>

Just simulate what the problem says.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem08" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem08" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;

char rotate (char ch) {
  if (ch == '/') return '\\';
  if (ch == '\\') return '/';
  if (ch == '+') return '+';
  if (ch == '-') return '|';
  if (ch == '|') return '-';
}

struct Quilt {
  int n, m;
  vector <string> grid;
  Quilt () {}
  Quilt (char ch) {
    if (ch == 'A') {
      grid.push_back("//");
      grid.push_back("/+");
    }
    if (ch == 'B') {
      grid.push_back("--");
      grid.push_back("--");
    }
    n = m = 2;
  }
  Quilt turn () {
    vector <string> turned(m, string(n, ' '));
    for (int r = 0; r < n; r++) {
      for (int c = 0; c < m; c++) {
        turned[c][n - 1 - r] = rotate(grid[r][c]);
      }
    }
    Quilt ret;
    ret.grid = turned;
    ret.m = n;
    ret.n = m;
    return ret;
  }
  Quilt sew (Quilt other) {
    vector <string> join(n, string(m + other.m, ' '));
    for (int r = 0; r < n; r++) {
      for (int c = 0; c < m; c++) {
        join[r][c] = grid[r][c];
      }
      for (int c = 0; c < other.m; c++) {
        join[r][m + c] = other.grid[r][c];
      }
    }
    Quilt ret;
    ret.grid = join;
    ret.n = n;
    ret.m = m + other.m;
    return ret;
  }
  void print () {
    for (string row: grid) cout << row << '\n';
  }
};

bool solve (string& command) {
  stack <int> op;
  vector <Quilt> ans;
  string cur = "";
  for (char ch: command) {
    if (ch == '(') {
      if (cur == "turn") op.push(1);
      else if (cur == "sew") op.push(2);
      else return false;
      cur = "";
    } else if (ch == ')') {
      if (not cur.empty()) {
        if (cur == "A") ans.push_back(Quilt('A'));
        else if (cur == "B") ans.push_back(Quilt('B'));
        else return false;
        cur = "";
      }
      if (op.empty()) return false;
      int option = op.top();
      op.pop();
      if (option == 1) {
        if (ans.size() < 1) return false;
        ans.back() = ans.back().turn();
      } else if (option == 2) {
        if (ans.size() < 2) return false;
        Quilt a = end(ans)[-2];
        Quilt b = end(ans)[-1];
        ans.pop_back();
        ans.pop_back();
        if (a.n != b.n) return false;
        ans.push_back(a.sew(b));
      }
    } else if (ch == ',') {
      if (cur != "") {
        if (cur == "A") ans.push_back(Quilt('A'));
        else if (cur == "B") ans.push_back(Quilt('B'));
        else return false;
      }
      cur = "";
    } else {
      cur += ch;
    }
  }
  if (ans.size() != 1) return false;
  ans[0].print();
  return true;
}

int main () {
  int tc = 0;
  char ch;
  string command = "";
  while ((ch = getchar()) != EOF) {
    if (ch == ' ' or ch == '\n') continue;
    if (ch == ';') {
      printf("Quilt %d:\n", ++tc);
      if (not solve(command)) puts("error");
      command = "";
    } else {
      command += ch;
    }
  }
  return (0);
}
```

  <!-- ends code -->

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/problemset/problem/652/B" target="_blank">Day 07: z-sort</a>

Sort the array and alternate taking elements (the smallest, the greater, the
second smallest, the second greater, ...).

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem07" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem07" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

using namespace std;

int main () {
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  vector <int> arr(n);
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) cin >> arr[i];
  sort(begin(arr), end(arr));
  int l = 0, r = n - 1;
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    if (i % 2 == 0) cout << arr[l++];
    else cout << arr[r--];
    cout << " \n"[i == n - 1];
  }
  return (0);
}
```

### <a href="https://atcoder.jp/contests/abc122/tasks/abc122_c" target="_blank">Day 06: GeT AC</a>

We can count how many `AC` there are in a range using prefix sums and taking
care or corner cases.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem06" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem06" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n, q;
  cin >> n >> q;
  string s;
  cin >> s;
  vector <int> ac(n + 1, 0);
  for (int i = 1; i < n; i++) {
    if (s[i - 1] == 'A' and s[i] == 'C') {
      ac[i + 1] = 1;
    }
  }
  for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) {
    ac[i] += ac[i - 1];
  }
  while (q--) {
    int l, r;
    cin >> l >> r;
    int x = ac[r] - ac[l - 1];
    if (ac[l] - ac[l - 1] == 1) x--;
    cout << x << '\n';
  }
  return (0);
}
```

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/contest/1266/problem/A" target="_blank">Day 05: Competitive Programmer</a>
$60 = 3 * 5 * 2 * 2$. Then, to verify that we can construct a number multiple of $60$ it is enough to
verify:

  * It is multiple of 3: the sum of digits is multiple of 3
  * It is multiple of 5 and 2: It ends in 0
  * It is multiple of 4: the last two digits are multiple of 4

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem05" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem05" class="collapse">
```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>
#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair
using namespace std;
typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;
int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  while (n--) {
    string s;
    cin >> s;
    if (sz(s) == 1) {
      if (s[0] == '0') cout << "red\n";
      else cout << "cyan\n";
      continue;
    }
    int zero = 0;
    int sum = 0;
    for (auto ch: s) zero += (ch == '0'), sum += (ch - '0');
    if (sum % 3 or !zero) {
      cout << "cyan\n";
      continue;
    }
    if (zero > 1) {
      cout << "red\n";
      continue;
    }
    bool ok = false;
    for (char ch: s) {
      if (ch == '0') continue;
      int num = (ch - '0') * 10;
      if (num % 4 == 0) ok = true;
    }
    if (ok) cout << "red\n";
    else cout << "cyan\n";
  }
  return (0);
}
```

  <!-- ends code -->

### <a href="https://atcoder.jp/contests/abc135/tasks/abc135_b" target="_blank">Day 04: 0 or 1 Swap</a>

Try every $i, j$. This solution is $O(N^3)$ and as $N \leq 50$ it is enough.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem04" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem04" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  vector <int> arr(n);
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) cin >> arr[i];
  vector <int> s = arr;
  sort(all(s));
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    for (int j = i; j < n; j++) {
      swap(arr[i], arr[j]);
      if (arr == s) {
        cout << "YES\n";
        return (0);
      }
      swap(arr[i], arr[j]);
    }
  }
  cout << "NO\n";
  return (0);
}
```

### <a href="https://atcoder.jp/contests/abc148/tasks/abc148_d" target="_blank">Day 03: Brick Break</a>

The problem is basically to find the largest continuous segment $[l, r] \mid a[l + i] = i + 1, 0 \leq i \leq r - l$. Notice that we can do it in $O(n)$.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem03" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem03" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

#define all(A) begin(A), end(A)
#define rall(A) rbegin(A), rend(A)
#define sz(A) int(A.size())
#define pb push_back
#define mp make_pair

using namespace std;

typedef long long ll;
typedef pair <int, int> pii;

int main () {
  ios::sync_with_stdio(false); cin.tie(0);
  int n;
  cin >> n;
  int cnt = 0;
  int cur = 1;
  for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    int elem;
    cin >> elem;
    if (elem == cur) cur++, cnt++;
  }
  int need = n - cnt;
  if (need <= n - 1) cout << need << '\n';
  else cout << -1 << '\n';
  return (0);
}
```

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/contest/1238/problem/A" target="_blank">Day 02: Prime Subtraction</a>

If $x - y = 1$ then the answer is no, else, by the fundamental theorem of
arithmetic $\exists \, p$ prime $: p | (x - y)$. So, the answer is yes.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem02" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem02" class="collapse">

```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

using namespace std;

int main () {
  int tc;
  cin >> tc;
  while (tc--) {
    long long x, y;
    cin >> x >> y;
    if (x - y == 1) cout << "NO\n";
    else cout << "YES\n";
  }
  return (0);
}
```

### <a href="https://codeforces.com/problemset/problem/1111/A" target="_blank">Day 01: Superhero Transformation</a>

Let $f(c) = 1$ if `c` is as vowel and $f(c) = 0$ otherwise. Then, the answer is
true iff $|s| = |t| \land f(s[i]) = f(t[i]) \quad \forall i \in [0, n)$.

  <!-- begin code -->
  <div class="collapsed code-title" type="button" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#codeProblem01" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="collapseTwo">
  <!-- title -->
  <i class="fas fa-caret-right"></i> <p class="title">Code</p>
  </div>
  <div id="codeProblem01" class="collapse">
  
```c++
#include <bits/stdc++.h>

using namespace std;

int f (char c) {
  if (c == 'a' or c == 'e' or c == 'i' or c == 'o' or c == 'u') return 1;
  return 0;
}

int main () {
  string s, t;
  cin >> s >> t;
  if (s.size() != t.size()) {
    cout << "No" << '\n';
    return (0);
  }
  bool ok = true;
  for (int i = 0; i < s.size(); i++) {
    if (f(s[i]) != f(t[i])) ok = false;    
  }
  if (ok) cout << "Yes\n";
  else cout << "No\n";
  return (0);
}
```
